Correlate source IP addresses with threat intelligence feeds identifying known malicious or botnet IPs. Analyze patterns of connection attempts from these IPs, focusing on volume and distribution. Use statistical methods (e.g., frequency analysis, entropy of source IPs) to identify unusually high volumes or dispersed sources targeting specific services or IPs within the network boundary.

Outbound connections from internal syste.Action: Collect network connection and DNS logs (Zeek conn.log, dns.log). Monitor outbound connections from internal hosts. Correlate destination IP addresses and domains with threat intelligence feeds for known C2 infrastructure, proxy services, or IPs associated with botnets. Identify hosts initiating connections to these suspicious destinations and analyze the connection patterns (e.g., frequency, duration, data volume) using time series analysis.

Large volume of low-intensity probes or.Action: Collect Zeek conn.log (and scan.log if available) on internet-facing network segments. Analyze inbound connection patterns for distributed scanning or probing behavior across multiple ports/services over time, originating from a high number of distinct source IPs. Use statistical methods (e.g., source IP count per destination port/service, frequency of scans from individual IPs, entropy of source IPs per targeted host/port) to identify patterns indicative of a distributed scan by a botnet rather than typical internet noise or targeted attacks from single/few sources.

Internal systems exhibiting connection p.Action: Monitor Zeek conn.log for internal hosts making connections to a high volume of disparate external IPs or receiving connections on non-standard ports from external sources. Correlate these network events with Windows Event ID 5156 (Network Connection) to identify the process initiating suspicious outbound connections or Windows Event ID 4688 (Process Creation) for processes listening on unusual ports or executing suspicious network utilities. Use statistical analysis (e.g., correlation of internal host IPs with high external connection counts, analysis of destination port/IP diversity using entropy) to identify outlier hosts with connection patterns inconsistent with normal behavior.
